relation: http://www.oz9aec.net/index.php/beaglebone/480-rtlizer Uses Bone, LCD and a DVB dongle.
Interface an FM radio SoC to the Beagle.
Make a real hardware bell ring when email arrives. Do it all on the Beagle without the need of a host PC.
Port TI's fixed-point speech recognizer to the DSP. It currently runs on the ARM.
Here and here are some interesting things people are doing with Kinects. Maybe we could port it to the Beagle.

Create a real-time audio Spectrum analyzer on the BeagleBoard. My realtime demo does much of this. You could initially find a JavaScript fft routine and have the browser to the computations. Project Page
pageTitle: Difference between revisions of "EBC Project Ideas" - eLinux.org
textBeforeTable: Fall 2012 Full Projects BeagleBoard/Ideas-2009 Google summer code ideas 2009. Android, this is one of a couple of efforts to port Google's Android OS to the Beagle. Augmented Reality Project, here's an idea that I think we can do on the Beagle. Rather than using augmented reality glasses, I'd suggest we use a TI DLP pico projector. Here's AR running on the Beagle. Official list of Beagle Projects, there are many Beagle specific projects listed here. Many are inactive. List your project here once it running. ETechDays Community Lightning Talks, this is a one-day web-based conference where many project ideas are presented. One of our 2009-2010 senior design projects was found here. Here are some links where you'll find ideas for your project. Do it all on the Beagle without the need of a host PC. Mark A. Yoder 3D Structured Light using DLP® Technology Create 3D maps using a DLP pico and the Beagle. Mark A. Yoder Beagle Midi Make the Beagle synthesize midi files. Mark A. Yoder Beagle Power Management Work up some power management demos. 2011 Edit this page to add projects you would like to do.
